Class javachart.chart.Pie 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class javachart.chart.Pie 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----javachart.chart.Pie
public class Pie
extends Object
Creates a single Pie component. Pies draw a series of slices proportional to Y data values for a specified Dataset. Each slice is drawn with the graphical attributes specified by its corresponding Datum's Gc class.

doDPie(Graphics, double, double)
Method for drawing Pie with a 3-D visual effect
doPie(Graphics, double, double)
Method for drawing overall Pie
draw(Graphics)
Draw this Pie on the specified Graphics

Inquires the Pie's relative height.

Inquires which Font will be used for this Pie's labels

Inquires where each slice's label should be drawn.
getLabelPrecision()
Returns the labels' floating point display precision.

Inquires whether this Pie will display each data point's percentage value.

Inquires where the first Pie slice will begin.

Inquires whether Pie slice information should accumulate in this chart's global DisplayList.

Inquires whether this Pie will display each data point's numeric value

Turns a double, say .53, into a String like "53%"

Sets an explosion value for this Pie slice.

Sets a new Font for use in drawing Pie labels
setLabelFormat(int)
Determines what format to use for this Pie's labels.
setLabelPosition(int)
Sets a position for Pie slice labels.
setLabelPrecision(int)
Set the labels' floating point display precision.
setPercentLabelsOn(boolean)
Toggles percentage labels for this Pie, which are off by default
setStartDegrees(int)
Determines where the first Pie slice will begin.
setTextLabelsOn(boolean)
Toggles Datum labels for this Pie, which are off by default.
setUseDisplayList(boolean)
Determines whether this Pie should add values to the chart's DisplayList.
setValueLabelsOn(boolean)
Toggles numeric labels for this Pie, which are on by default.
setWidth(double)
Determines the Pie's relative width.
setXLoc(double)
Sets the X location of the center of this Pie.
setYLoc(double)
Sets the Y location of the center of this Pie.

draw 
  public synchronized void draw(Graphics g)
Draw this Pie on the specified Graphics
setExplosion 
  public synchronized void setExplosion(int whichSlice,
                                        double exp)
Sets an explosion value for this Pie slice. This value ranges from 0 to 1, and shifts a specified slice radially away from the Pie center by the specified amount.
Parameters:
whichSlice - Slice to explode
exp - How much to explode
getTextLabelsOn 
  public boolean getTextLabelsOn()
Inquires whether this Pie will draw each data point's Datum label
Returns:
True if text labels will draw
See Also:
Datum
setTextLabelsOn 
  public void setTextLabelsOn(boolean onOff)
Toggles Datum labels for this Pie, which are off by default.
Parameters:
onOff - True for Datum labels
See Also:
Datum
getValueLabelsOn 
  public boolean getValueLabelsOn()
Inquires whether this Pie will display each data point's numeric value
Returns:
True if value labels will draw
setValueLabelsOn 
  public void setValueLabelsOn(boolean onOff)
Toggles numeric labels for this Pie, which are on by default.
Parameters:
onOff - True for value labels
getPercentLabelsOn 
  public boolean getPercentLabelsOn()
Inquires whether this Pie will display each data point's percentage value.
Returns:
True if percentage labels will draw
setPercentLabelsOn 
  public void setPercentLabelsOn(boolean onOff)
Toggles percentage labels for this Pie, which are off by default
Parameters:
onOff - True for percentage labels
getLabelPosition 
  public int getLabelPosition()
Inquires where each slice's label should be drawn. @return Pie label position
setLabelPosition 
  public void setLabelPosition(int pos)
Sets a position for Pie slice labels. 0 - in the center of each slice, 1 - at the edge of each slice, 2 - outside the slice with a pointer line.
Parameters:
pos - label position
getLabelPrecision 
  public int getLabelPrecision()
Returns the labels' floating point display precision. A precision of 2 yields labels like "1.11". A precision of 4 makes labels like "1.1111"
Returns:
label precision
setLabelPrecision 
  public void setLabelPrecision(int i)
Set the labels' floating point display precision.
Parameters:
i - A new label precision
getLabelFormat 
  public int getLabelFormat()
Returns this Pie's label format value.
Returns:
label format
setLabelFormat 
  public void setLabelFormat(int fmt)
Determines what format to use for this Pie's labels. The default is Gc.DEFAULT_FORMAT, which is a machine-dependent representation for Java 1.0x, and may include Scientific notation. Other possibilities include Gc.COMMA_FORMAT, which formats numbers as 1,000.00 and Gc.EURO_FORMAT, which formats numbers like 1.000,00.
Parameters:
i - label format
getXLoc 
  public double getXLoc()
Inquires the X location of the center of this Pie. Values returned range from 0 to 1
Returns:
X location
setXLoc 
  public void setXLoc(double loc)
Sets the X location of the center of this Pie. Valid values range from 0 to 1.
Parameters:
loc - X location
getYLoc 
  public double getYLoc()
Inquires the Y location of the center of this Pie. Values returned range from 0 to 1
Returns:
Y location
setYLoc 
  public void setYLoc(double loc)
Sets the Y location of the center of this Pie. Valid values range from 0 to 1.
Parameters:
loc - Y location
getStartDegrees 
  public int getStartDegrees()
Inquires where the first Pie slice will begin. Default value is 0, which is at 3 o' clock.
Returns:
start degrees
setStartDegrees 
  public void setStartDegrees(int deg)
Determines where the first Pie slice will begin. All values are in degrees, based on 0 at 3 o'clock
Parameters:
deg - degrees of rotation
getWidth 
  public double getWidth()
Inquires the Pie's relative width. Values range from 0 to 1. Default is 0.6, or 60% of the entire chart area.
Returns:
Pie width
setWidth 
  public void setWidth(double w)
Determines the Pie's relative width. Values range from 0 to 1. Default is 0.6, or 60% of the entire chart area.
Parameters:
w - Pie width
getHeight 
  public double getHeight()
Inquires the Pie's relative height. Values range from 0 to 1. Default is 0.6, or 60% of the entire chart area.
Returns:
Pie height
setHeight 
  public void setHeight(double h)
Determines the Pie's relative height. Values range from 0 to 1. Default is 0.6, or 60% of the entire chart area.
Parameters:
h - Pie height

Pie label font

Sets a new Font for use in drawing Pie labels

f - Pie label font

setLabelColor 
  public void setLabelColor(Color c)
Sets a new color for Pie labels
Parameters:
c - New label color
getUseDisplayList 
  public boolean getUseDisplayList()
Inquires whether Pie slice information should accumulate in this chart's global DisplayList. True by default.
setUseDisplayList 
  public void setUseDisplayList(boolean onOff)
Determines whether this Pie should add values to the chart's DisplayList. By default this is true.
Parameters:
onOff - New status of useDisplayList
See Also:
DisplayList

                       double xCenter,
                       double yCenter)
Method for drawing overall Pie
Parameters:
g - Graphics to draw
xCenter - X location in percentage coordinates
